Key Arguments: The legislation serves the interests of big government rather than the average Australian.
Government values and opinions change, making it difficult to define truth consistently.
Online users are capable of discerning truth without government intervention.
During the COVID-19 pandemic, information was suppressed, and this legislation could exacerbate such issues.
Politicians and experts were silenced for opposing government narratives, which is undemocratic.
Notable Quotes: We online users are more able to work out the truth for ourselves we do not need the big hand of government censorship.
This legislation would have enabled politicians to persuade the media platforms to suppress such information even more than they did during covid.
